article.heading: Share and reuse of interoperability solutions between public sector bodies, Union institutions, agencies and bodies

content.p: A public sector body or Union institution, agency or body shall make available to any other such entity that requests it, interoperability solutions that support their digital services to be delivered or managed electronically. The shared content shall include the technical documentation and, where applicable, the documented source code. This obligation to share shall not apply to interoperability solutions:

that support processes which fall outside the scope of the public task of the public sector bodies or Union institutions, agencies or bodies concerned as defined by law or by other binding rules, or, in the absence of such rules, as defined in accordance with common administrative practice in the Member State or Union administrations in question, provided that the scope of the public tasks is transparent and subject to review;
for which third parties hold intellectual property rights;
access to which is excluded or restricted on grounds of:
sensitive critical infrastructure protection related information as defined in Article 2, point (d) of Directive 2008/114/EC;
the protection of national security, State security, defence, or public security;

access to which is restricted by virtue of the access regimes in the Member States, including situations where citizens or legal entities must prove a particular interest to obtain access to documents.

To enable the reusing entity to manage the solution autonomously, the owner of the solution shall specify the guarantees that will be provided to the reusing agencies in terms of cooperation, support and maintenance. Reusing entities shall before adopting the solutions provide an assessment of the solution covering the ability of managing autonomously the cybersecurity and the evolution of the reused solution.
